spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout roughly matches (2 bedrooms left/right, central living/dining, kitchen + utility bottom-left, two toilets, two decks), but multiple spatial details diverge. E2/E4: foyer/entry zone appears resized (3D shows different foyer width/labeling vs 2D 4'6" x 3'8" + 4'6" x 4'7"). E2: several door locations/orientations do not precisely match the 2D (notably around living-to-passage and bath/bedroom door swings). E2/E1: window/opening placement is not faithfully represented—2D shows multiple exterior windows and deck openings; 3D largely depicts solid exterior walls with few/no clear window cutouts. E4: deck proportions (especially the large top deck) and some room widths appear visually compressed/expanded relative to the 2D dimensions.

structural_fidelity.notes: E1/E2: Major structural fidelity loss from missing/unclear exterior fenestration (windows/sliders) that are integral to the 2D plan. E2: door embedding/swing correctness is inconsistent (door locations look approximate rather than exact; some openings appear shifted). Adjacencies are mostly correct (kitchen next to living, utility next to kitchen, toilets near bedrooms/passage), and no obvious extra rooms are added. Wall thickness looks generally consistent, but several boundaries/openings are simplified compared to the 2D.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture is plausible and generally aligned with room functions (beds in bedrooms, sofa + dining in living, counters in kitchen). E2: some furniture placement/orientation does not match the 2D intent (living seating arrangement differs; kitchen/utility fixtures simplified). E4: scale feels slightly off in a few areas (dining set clearance and sofa-to-wall spacing vs the tight 2D proportions).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric viewpoint is clear and readable, with decent lighting and generally clean geometry. However, E6: lack of modeled windows/openings reduces realism and clarity of the architecture. Orthographic/isometric fidelity is slightly compromised by mild perspective feel and simplified openings. Composition is good but overall architectural legibility is impacted by missing fenestration.

detected_errors.description: Most exterior windows and/or sliding door openings shown on the 2D plan are missing or not clearly modeled as cutouts in the 3D render.
Foyer/entry area sizing and boundary placement differ from the 2D plan dimensions (appears widened/altered in 3D).
Several door placements and/or swing orientations appear approximate rather than matching the exact 2D locations (notably around the living-to-passage and toilet/bedroom entries).
Room/deck proportions are not consistently preserved; the large deck and some interior clearances appear visually compressed/expanded relative to the 2D dimensioned plan.
Bedroom identification/function mapping is inconsistent with the 2D labeling (left bedroom is BED-2 in 2D but appears mislabeled/treated as BED-1 in the 3D).
Rendering/asset simplification (solid exterior walls, limited fenestration detail) reduces architectural fidelity to the 2D plan.
